author: bharath.vedartham
content: With ePBS, i believe the circuit breaker logic should change such that when there are a certain threshold of missed slots. The proposer should fallback to p2p bidding rather than just self-building as specified today

author: bharath.vedartham
content:
also want to know what ppl think about: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/874767108809031740/1459588869686038650 
we could potentially avoid replay attacks by also requiring that the validator registration endpoint be authenticated similar to the get bid endpoint?

author: potuz
content: I think the circuit breaker should be gone on ePBS and just ban/unban individual builders aggresively with different heuristics.

author: bharath.vedartham
content:
thats an interesting idea. today we already can ban a builder by removing them off the mev-boost whitelist but thats a manual process. 
I think we can still have fallback when there are missed slots.
Will per builder ban be global or per validator?

author: bharath.vedartham
content: if a validator bans a builder then will it ban it forever? we could have a cool down logic but if the proposer next proposes after 2-3 months, then how do we define a cooldown? in terms of blocks?

author: bharath.vedartham
content: the most non-invasive change for now to me, seems to have the fallback to local + p2p bidding and then let proposers manually blacklist?
